Guest Molecules.Mechanism: Adsorption, monolayer formation on homogeneous sites; influenced by size exclusion and hydrophobic interactions.

Other Information.Additional Info: Langmuir model provided best fit for adsorption isotherm.

Guest Molecules.Mechanism: Adsorption, multilayer formation on heterogeneous sites; influenced by size exclusion and hydrophobic interactions.

Other Information.Additional Info: Freundlich model provided best fit for adsorption isotherm.

Guest Molecules.Mechanism: Adsorption, multilayer formation on heterogeneous sites; influenced by size exclusion and hydrophobic interactions.

Other Information.Additional Info: Freundlich model provided best fit for adsorption isotherm.

Sieving Mechanism: Differential adsorption based on size-exclusion effect and hydrophobic interactions, limited by restricted pore accessibility for bulky alkylphenols.

Experimental Validation.Method: Adsorption kinetic and isotherm studies, N2 physisorption, SEM, TEM, FT-IR, XPS
Experimental Validation.Performance Metrics: Maximum adsorption capacity: BPA 31.77 mg g-1, 4-BP 32.89 mg g-1, PP 104.85 mg g-1. Pseudo-second-order model best fit for kinetics.

Other Information.Additional Info: Base UiO-66 structure with microporous framework, limiting uptake capacity for bulky alkylphenols. High chemical and thermal stability.

Guest Molecules.Mechanism: Adsorption, monolayer formation; enhanced accessibility due to mesopores; influenced by size exclusion and hydrophobic interactions.

Other Information.Additional Info: Langmuir model provided best fit for adsorption isotherm.

Guest Molecules.Mechanism: Adsorption, multilayer formation; enhanced accessibility due to mesopores; influenced by size exclusion and hydrophobic interactions.

Other Information.Additional Info: Freundlich model provided best fit for adsorption isotherm.

Guest Molecules.Mechanism: Adsorption, multilayer formation; enhanced accessibility due to mesopores; influenced by size exclusion and hydrophobic interactions.

Other Information.Additional Info: Freundlich model provided best fit for adsorption isotherm.

Sieving Mechanism: Enhanced differential adsorption due to mesoporous structure and increased pore accessibility, combined with hydrophobic interactions.

Experimental Validation.Method: Adsorption kinetic and isotherm studies, N2 physisorption, SEM, TEM, FT-IR, XPS
Experimental Validation.Performance Metrics: Maximum adsorption capacity: BPA 39.71 mg g-1, 4-BP 52.67 mg g-1, PP 117.09 mg g-1. Pseudo-second-order model best fit for kinetics.

Other Information.Additional Info: Mesoporous structure created via thermal treatment and acidification of UiO-66-NH2–50 %. Exhibited a rougher surface.

Pore/Structural Features.Structure Type: Mesoporous structure with apparent mesopores and enhanced pore accessibility

Guest Molecules.Mechanism: Adsorption, monolayer formation; significantly enhanced pore accessibility and hydrophobicity due to modification, influenced by size exclusion.

Other Information.Additional Info: Langmuir model provided best fit for adsorption isotherm. Adsorption is exothermic and spontaneous at given temperature.

Guest Molecules.Mechanism: Adsorption, multilayer formation; significantly enhanced pore accessibility and hydrophobicity due to modification, influenced by size exclusion.

Other Information.Additional Info: Freundlich model provided best fit for adsorption isotherm. Adsorption is endothermic and non-spontaneous.

Guest Molecules.Mechanism: Adsorption, multilayer formation; significantly enhanced pore accessibility and hydrophobicity due to modification, resulting in highest adsorption capacity.

Other Information.Additional Info: Freundlich model provided best fit for adsorption isotherm. Adsorption is exothermic and spontaneous at given temperature.

Sieving Mechanism: Molecular sieving driven by significantly enhanced pore accessibility and hydrophobicity, leading to size- and hydrophobicity-dependent differential adsorption capacities.

Experimental Validation.Method: Adsorption kinetic and isotherm studies, N2 physisorption, SEM, TEM, FT-IR, XPS, Reusability tests, Stability tests (XRD, SEM for regenerated material)
Experimental Validation.Performance Metrics: Highest theoretical maximum adsorption capacity: BPA 40.64 mg g-1, 4-BP 115.06 mg g-1, PP 673.17 mg g-1. Pseudo-second-order model best fit for kinetics. Maintained >80% adsorption capacity after 5 cycles for PP. Excellent structural stability and durability under varying pH conditions (pH 5 and 9).

Other Information.Additional Info: Post-modified from HCl‑meso-UiO-66 with 4-pentylbenzoic acid, resulting in a smoother surface and increased hydrophobicity. Exhibited the highest adsorption capacity among the UiO-66 series for alkylphenols, particularly for PP.
